client.Users

Class UserServices

  • java.lang.Object
    • client.Users.UserServices

  • public class UserServices
extends java.lang.Object
    This class handles all the business logic related to the User (login, etc.)

        Returns:
        the encrypted password.

      • handleLogin

        public void handleLogin(java.lang.String login,
                        java.lang.String password)
        This method is called whenever the client wants to connect. The display calls this function.
        Parameters:
        login: - the email the client enters.
        password: - the password the client enters

      • setFirstPassword

        public void setFirstPassword(java.lang.String login,
                             java.lang.String password)
        This method is called whenever the client wants to set up his account for his first connection. The display calls this function.
        Parameters:
        login: - the email the client enters.
        password: - the (first) password the client enters.

      • handleAnswerLogin

        public void handleAnswerLogin(java.lang.String loginString)
        When the server responds to a LOGIN command sent by this client. This method interprets what is returned.
        Parameters:
        loginString: - the response from the server.

                       java.lang.String email,

                       java.lang.String password,
                       java.lang.String jobType)

        name - : user name
        firstName - : user first name
        birthDate - : user birth date
        email - : user login
        password - : user password
        jobType - : the user job type
        role - : user role

                            java.lang.String role,
                            int isAdmin)

        Parameters:
        id - the user ID
        name - the user name
        firstName - the user first name
        birthDate - the user birth date
        email - the user email
        isAdmin - the user state regarding its admin capabilities
        role - teh user role.
